thread.title: Former Arsenal, Chelsea and Real Madrid star Lassana Diarra heads for the moneybags Chinese Super League with Shandong Luneng
thread.title_full: Former Arsenal, Chelsea and Real Madrid star Lassana Diarra heads for the moneybags Chinese Super League with Shandong Luneng

author: gsweet
title: Former Arsenal, Chelsea and Real Madrid star Lassana Diarra heads for the moneybags Chinese Super League with Shandong Luneng
text:
EFL I'M IN THE MONEY Former Arsenal, Chelsea and Real Madrid star Lassana Diarra heads for the moneybags Chinese Super League with Shandong Luneng 
Former Arsenal and Chelsea midfielder needs a big pay day - he still owes Lokomotiv Moscow £6.8million Gossip EX-Arsenal, Chelsea and Portsmouth midfielder Lassana Diarra is heading to China. 
Diarra, 31, has left Marseille after a mutual agreement and is looking for pastures new. Getty Images Lassana Diarra…contract at Marseille cancelled by mutual consent 
The inside word is that he’ll hit the moneybags trail to the Chinese Super League . 
Keep up to date with ALL the Premier League gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Diarra’s agent is said to be in advanced negotiations with Shandong Luneng about a lucrative move. 
Shandong Luneng are managed by Felix Magath, the German who had an ill-fated spell at Fulham. Getty Images 3 Diarra in Premier League action for Arsenal against Wigan 
Diarra, who was linked with Valencia during last month’s transfer window but remained with the Ligue 1 club, has every reason to chase a big cheque. Related Stories Zlatan Ibrahimovic's Europa League hat-trick saved his team-mates from a furious Jose Mourinho blast i'M JUR MAN Chelsea wonderkid Dominic Solanke is ready to join Liverpool in a stunning summer switch Fight club Alexis Sanchez set to quit Arsenal in the summer following dressing room bust up after Bayern Munich defeat CLATT'S CHINA SNUB Mark Clattenburg turned down £1m-a-year offer from China before quitting Prem for Saudi Arabia GENT OUT OF SHAPE Pochettino watches stuttering Spurs slump to another loss and moans: We’re in a bad way SHINDIG Florentin Pogba shows off his custom shinpads with brother Paul's face... but he's still wearing a Juventus shirt 
For the Frenchman owes former club Lokomotiv Moiscow £6.8million for breaching his contract in 2016. 
He joined the Russian club in 2013 on a four-year contract but quit after a year. Getty Images Diarra later moved on to Portsmouth under Harry Redknapp Saves of the Week : Watch the Premier League goalkeepers in all their glory 
Diarra has also played for Real Madrid and Russian clubs Anzhi Makhachkala. 
Always looked upon as a blossoming talent during his time in the Premier League. Diarra played just 13 games for Chelsea, seven for Arsenal and 24 for Pompey under Harry Redknapp.
